meanings.definition: To clean or scrub with a mixture of water and soap.
meanings.sent1: I will soogee the dishes after dinner.
meanings.sent2: She always soogees the kitchen floor on Saturdays.
meanings.sent3: The kids thought it was fun to soogee the car windows.
meanings.sent4: After the storm, the rain helped to soogee the streets clean.
meanings.sent5: The maid soogeed the hotel room until it sparkled.

meanings.definition: A cleaning solution made of water and soap.
meanings.sent1: Mom asked me to get the soogee from under the sink.
meanings.sent2: The soogee smelled fresh and clean.
meanings.sent3: The soogee spilled all over the floor, making a bubbly mess.
meanings.sent4: The soogee bottle was almost empty, so I needed to buy more.
meanings.sent5: The soogee was so effective at removing stains from the carpet.
